trans-unit.source: All executable code statements within a single procedure division paragraph or section.

trans-unit.source: All files are initially described to a GnuCOBOL program using a SELECT statement (see SELECT). In addition to defining a name by which the file will be referenced within the program, the SELECT statement will specify the name and path by which the file will be known to the operating system along with its organization, locking and sharing attributes.

All files are initially described to a GnuCOBOL program using aSELECTstatement (see SELECT). In addition to defining a name by which the file will be referenced within the program, theSELECTstatement will specify the name and path by which the file will be known to the operating system along with its organization, locking and sharing attributes.
trans-unit.target: Todos los archivos se describen inicialmente en un programa GnuCOBOL usando una instrucción SELECT (ver SELECT ). Además de definir un nombre por el cual se hará referencia al archivo dentro del programa, la instrucción SELECT especificará el nombre y la ruta por la cual el archivo será conocido por el sistema operativo junto con sus atributos de organización, bloqueo y uso compartido.

trans-unit.source: AllCOPYstatements are located and the contents of the corresponding copybooks inserted into the program source code before the actual compilation process begins. If a copybook contains aCOPYstatement, the copybook insertion process will be repeated to resolve the embeddedCOPY This will continue until no unresolvedCOPYstatements remain. At that point, actual program compilation will begin.
trans-unit.target: Todas las declaraciones de COPY se ubican y el contenido de los cuadernos correspondientes se inserta en el código fuente del programa antes de que comience el proceso de compilación real. Si un cuaderno contiene una declaración COPY , el proceso de inserción del copybook se repetirá para resolver la COPY incrustada. Esto continuará hasta que no queden declaraciones COPY sin resolver . En ese momento, comenzará la compilación real del programa.

trans-unit.source: Allocate level-01 data items in alphabetical sequence in the program source wherever practical. Alternate entry-points provide multiple ways in which the same subroutine may be called; presumably, each entry-point will provide some different functionality to the calling program. For example, if you wished to write a subroutine that manipulates "student" records in a database, you might have the primary entry-point name retrieve a student record from the database, while the alternate entry points Add-Student, Update-Student and Delete-Student could provide the alternate functions implied by their entry-point names.

Alternate entry-points provide multiple ways in which the same subroutine may be called; presumably, each entry-point will provide some different functionality to the calling program. For example, if you wished to write a subroutine that manipulates "student" records in a database, you might have the primary entry-point name retrieve a student record from the database, while the alternate entry pointsAdd-StudentUpdate-StudentandDelete-Studentcould provide the alternate functions implied by their entry-point names.
trans-unit.target: Los puntos de entrada alternativos proporcionan múltiples formas en las que se puede llamar a la misma subrutina; presumiblemente, cada punto de entrada proporcionará alguna funcionalidad diferente al programa de llamada. Por ejemplo, si desea escribir una subrutina que manipule los registros de "estudiantes" en una base de datos, puede hacer que el nombre del punto de entrada principal recupere un registro de estudiante de la base de datos, mientras que los puntos de entrada alternativos Add-Student Update-Student y Delete-Student podría proporcionar las funciones alternativas implícitas en sus nombres de punto de entrada.

trans-unit.source: An AT END clause
An AT END clause detects and handles the case where either form of table search has failed to locate an entry that satisfies the search conditions being used.

An EXIT PERFORM CYCLE statement will terminate the current iteration of the in-line PERFORM, giving control to any TIMES, VARYING and/or UNTIL clauses for them to determine if another cycle needs to be performed.

An EXIT PERFORM statement will terminate the in-line PERFORM outright, transferring control to the first statement following the END-PERFORM (if there is one) or to the next sentence following the PERFORM if there is no END-PERFORM.

An EXIT PROGRAM statement returns control back to the statement following the CALL (see CALL) of the subprogram. An EXIT FUNCTION statement returns control back to the processing of the statement in the calling program that invoked the user-defined function.
An EXTERNAL item must have a data name and that name cannot be FILLER.

An ON OVERFLOW clause will allow your program to trap a failure condition that has occurred and handle it gracefully by executing imperative-statement-1 (see Imperative Statement). If such a condition occurs at runtime without having one of these clauses specified, an error message will be generated (by the GnuCOBOL runtime library) to the SYSERR device (pipe 2). The program may also be terminated, depending upon the type and severity of the error.

trans-unit.source: An alphanumeric literal

An alphanumeric literal is not valid for use in arithmetic expressions unless it is first converted to it’s numeric computational equivalent; there are three numeric conversion intrinsic functions built into GnuCOBOL that can perform this conversion —NUMVAL(see NUMVAL),NUMVAL-C(see NUMVAL-C) andNUMVAL-F(see NUMVAL-F).
trans-unit.target: Un literal alfanumérico no es válido para su uso en expresiones aritméticas a menos que primero se convierta a su equivalente computacional numérico; Hay tres funciones intrínsecas de conversión numérica integradas en GnuCOBOL que pueden realizar esta conversión: NUMVAL (ver NUMVAL ), NUMVAL-C (ver NUMVAL-C ) y NUMVAL-F (ver NUMVAL-F ).

trans-unit.source: An alphanumeric literal is not valid for use in arithmetic expressions unless it is first converted to its numeric computational equivalent; there are three numeric conversion intrinsic functions built into GnuCOBOL that can perform this conversion — NUMVAL (see NUMVAL), NUMVAL-C (see NUMVAL-C) and NUMVAL-F (see NUMVAL-F).

An alphanumeric literal prefixed with an upper- or lower-case "Z" character — for example,Z'ABC' These literals are one character longer than the value within apostrophes or quotes would make them appear. The extra character (the last character) will be a null character (comprised entirely of zero bits). These literals are ideal when defining or assigning values to alphanumeric data items that will be passed as arguments to a C subroutine. See Alphanumeric Literals.
trans-unit.target: Un literal alfanumérico prefijado con un carácter "Z" en mayúscula o minúscula; por ejemplo, Z'ABC' Estos literales son un carácter más largos que el valor entre apóstrofos o comillas que los haría aparecer. El carácter adicional (el último carácter) será un carácter nulo (compuesto en su totalidad por bits cero). Estos literales son ideales al definir o asignar valores a elementos de datos alfanuméricos que se pasarán como argumentos a una subrutina C. Consulte Literales alfanuméricos .

trans-unit.source: An exit procedure, once registered, will trigger whenever a STOP RUN statement (see STOP) or a GOBACK statement (see GOBACK) is executed anywhere in the program. The exit procedure may execute whatever code is desired to undertake an orderly shut down of the program. Once the exit procedure terminates by executing an EXIT PROGRAM statement (see EXIT) or a GOBACK statement, the system-standard program termination routine will be executed.

An exit procedure, once registered, will trigger whenever aSTOP RUNstatement (see STOP) or aGOBACKstatement (see GOBACK) is executed anywhere in the program. The exit procedure may execute whatever code is desired to undertake an orderly shut down of the program. Once the exit procedure terminates by executing anEXIT PROGRAMstatement (see EXIT) or aGOBACKstatement, the system-standard program termination routine will be executed.
trans-unit.target: Un procedimiento de salida, una vez registrado, se activará siempre que se ejecute una instrucción STOP RUN (ver STOP ) o una instrucción GOBACK (ver GOBACK ) en cualquier parte del programa. El procedimiento de salida puede ejecutar cualquier código que se desee para realizar un cierre ordenado del programa. Una vez que el procedimiento de salida termina al ejecutar una instrucción EXIT PROGRAM (ver EXIT ) o una instrucción GOBACK , se ejecutará la rutina de terminación del programa estándar del sistema.

Another way in which a data item may be shared between a calling program (

Another way in which a data item may be shared between a calling program ("A") and a called program ("B") is by defining the data item in the calling program and attaching theGLOBAL(see GLOBAL) clause to it so that it may be used within the called program. In order for this to work, program "B" (the one called by program "A") must be a nested subprogram within program "A".
trans-unit.target: Otra forma en que un elemento de datos puede ser compartido entre un programa de llamada ("A") y un programa llamado ("B") es definiendo el elemento de datos en el programa de llamada y adjuntando la cláusula GLOBAL (ver GLOBAL ) de manera que que se puede utilizar dentro del programa llamado. Para que esto funcione, el programa "B" (el llamado por el programa "A") debe ser un subprograma anidado dentro del programa "A".

trans-unit.source: As data is loaded into the sort work file, it is actually being buffered in dynamically-allocated memory. Only if the amount of data to be sorted exceeds the amount of available sort memory (128 MB) will actual disk files be allocated and utilized. There is a COB_SORT_MEMORY run-time environment variable (see Run Time Environment Variables) that you may use to allocate more or less memory to the sorting process.
As discussed previously, dynamically-loadable libraries are created via the compiler’s

As discussed previously, dynamically-loadable libraries are created via the compiler’s-mswitch. Once so created, the program(s) in these libraries are executed from the command line (via the GnuCOBOLcobcrunutility), or as dynamically-loadable subprograms.
trans-unit.target: Como se discutió anteriormente, las bibliotecas cargables dinámicamente se crean a través del modificador -m del compilador . Una vez creados, los programas de estas bibliotecas se ejecutan desde la línea de comandos (a través de la utilidad cobcrun de cobcrun ) o como subprogramas cargables dinámicamente.

trans-unit.source: As far as enforcement goes, however, both alphabetic and numeric picture strings do provide for both compile-time and run-time enforcement capabilities. In the case of compilation enforcement, the compiler can issue warning messages if you attempt to specify a non-numeric value for a numeric data item or if you attempt to MOVE (see MOVE) a non-numeric data item to one that is numeric. Similar capabilities exist for alphabetic data items. At run-time, you may use a special class test (see Class Conditions) to determine if the contents of a data item are entirely numeric or entirely alphabetic.

As far as enforcement goes, however, both alphabetic and numeric picture strings do provide for both compile-time and run-time enforcement capabilities. In the case of compilation enforcement, the compiler can issue warning messages if you attempt to specify a non-numeric value for a numeric data item or if you attempt toMOVE(see MOVE) a non-numeric data item to one that is numeric. Similar capabilities exist for alphabetic data items. At run-time, you may use a special class test (see Class Conditions) to determine if the contents of a data item are entirely numeric or entirely alphabetic.
trans-unit.target: Sin embargo, en lo que respecta a la aplicación, las cadenas de imágenes tanto alfabéticas como numéricas proporcionan capacidades de aplicación tanto en tiempo de compilación como en tiempo de ejecución. En el caso de la aplicación de la compilación, el compilador puede emitir mensajes de advertencia si intenta especificar un valor no numérico para un elemento de datos numéricos o si intenta MOVE R (ver MOVER ) un elemento de datos no numérico a uno que sea numérico. Existen capacidades similares para elementos de datos alfabéticos. En tiempo de ejecución, puede usar una prueba de clase especial (consulte Condiciones de clase ) para determinar si el contenido de un elemento de datos es completamente numérico o completamente alfabético.

trans-unit.source: As is the case in almost any other programming language, the programmer is always free to use pairs of parenthesis to enclose sub-expressions of complex expressions that are to be evaluated before other sub-expressions rather than let operator precedence dictate the sequence of evaluation.
trans-unit.target: Como ocurre en casi todos los lenguajes de programación,el programador siempre es libre de utilizar pares de paréntesis para encerrar subexpresiones de expresiones complejas que deben evaluarse antes que otras subexpresiones,en lugar de dejar que la precedencia del operador dicte la secuencia de evaluación.

trans-unit.source: As of the COBOL2002 standard, a second mode now exists for COBOL source code statements — in this mode of operation, COBOL statements may each be up to 255 characters long, with no specific requirements as to what should appear in which columns.
trans-unit.target: A partir del estándar COBOL2002, ahora existe un segundo modo para las sentencias de código fuente COBOL; en este modo de operación, las sentencias COBOL pueden tener cada una hasta 255 caracteres de longitud, sin requisitos específicos en cuanto a qué debe aparecer en qué columnas.

trans-unit.source: As the MERGE statement begins execution, the first record in each of the USING files is read automatically.

As the MERGE statement executes, the current record from each of the USING files is examined and compared to each other according to the rules set forth by the KEY clause and the alphabet (see Alphabet-Name-Clause) specified on the COLLATING SEQUENCE clause. The record that should be next in sequence will be written to the merge work file and the USING file from which that record came will be read so that its next record is available. As end-of-file conditions are reached on USING files, those files will be excluded from further processing — processing continues with the remaining files until all the contents of all of them have been exhausted.

trans-unit.source: As was presented earlier (see Structured Data), a data item that is broken down into other data items is referred to as a group item, while one that isn’t broken down is called an elementary item.
trans-unit.target: Como se presentó anteriormente (consulte Datos estructurados ), un elemento de datos que se divide en otros elementos de datos se denomina elemento de grupo, mientras que uno que no se desglosa se denomina elemento elemental.

trans-unit.source: As with the other divisions, the procedure division may consist of sections and those sections may — in turn — consist of paragraphs. Unlike the other divisions, however, section and paragraph names are defined by the programmer, and there may not be any defined at all if the programmer so wishes.
trans-unit.target: Al igual que con las otras divisiones, la división de procedimientos puede constar de secciones y esas secciones pueden, a su vez, constar de párrafos. Sin embargo, a diferencia de las otras divisiones, los nombres de las secciones y párrafos los define el programador, y es posible que no haya ninguno definido si el programador así lo desea.

trans-unit.source: As you can see, there was a huge drop in USAGE COMP timings by turning off truncation. As a result, I see absolutely no reason whatsoever why the

As you can see, there was a huge drop inUSAGE COMPtimings by turning off truncation. As a result, I see absolutely no reason whatsoever why the-fnotruncswitch option shouldn’t be used on all GnuCOBOL compilations.
trans-unit.target: Como puede ver, hubo una gran caída en los tiempos de USAGE COMP al desactivar el truncamiento. Como resultado, no veo absolutamente ninguna razón por la cual la opción de cambio -fnotrunc no debería usarse en todas las compilaciones de GnuCOBOL.

trans-unit.source: Avoid the use of level 77 data items in new programs. Once (1968 and before) there were valid reasons for creating level-77 data items, but since the 1974 ANSI standard of COBOL there really hasn’t been any reason why an elementary level-01 data item couldn’t have been used instead of a level-77 item.
trans-unit.target: Evite el uso de elementos de datos de nivel 77 en programas nuevos. Una vez (1968 y antes) hubo razones válidas para crear elementos de datos de nivel 77, pero desde el estándar ANSI de COBOL de 1974, realmente no ha habido ninguna razón por la que no se haya podido utilizar un elemento de datos de nivel 01 elemental en lugar de un elemento de nivel 77.

trans-unit.source: BINARY-LONG SIGNED — An occurrence of this register exists for each report defined in the program (via anRD(see REPORT SECTION)). If there are multiple reports, any explicit references to this register not made in the report section will require qualification OF report-name. The value of this register will be the current logical line number on the current page. The value of this register cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: BINARIO DE FIRMA LARGA: existe una ocurrencia de este registro para cada informe definido en el programa (a través de un RD (ver SECCIÓN DE INFORME )). Si hay varios informes, cualquier referencia explícita a este registro que no se haga en la sección del informe requerirá la calificación OF report-name . El valor de este registro será el número de línea lógica actual en la página actual. El valor de este registro no se puede modificar.

trans-unit.source: BINARY-LONG SIGNED — An occurrence of this register exists for each report having anRD(see REPORT SECTION). If there are multiple such reports, any explicit references to this register not made in the report section will require qualification (OF report-name. The value of this register will be the current report page number. The value of this register cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: BINARIO DE FIRMA LARGA: existe una ocurrencia de este registro para cada informe que tiene un RD (consulte la SECCIÓN DE INFORME ). Si hay varios informes de este tipo, cualquier referencia explícita a este registro que no se haga en la sección del informe requerirá calificación ( OF report-name . El valor de este registro será el número de página del informe actual. El valor de este registro no se puede modificar.

trans-unit.source: BINARY-LONG SIGNED — An occurrence of this register exists for each selected file having aLINAGE(see File/Sort-Description) clause. If there are multiple files whose file descriptions haveLINAGEclauses, any explicit references to this register will require qualification (usingOF file-name. The value of this register will be the current logical line number within the page body. The value of this register cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: BINARY-LONG SIGNED - Existe una ocurrencia de este registro para cada archivo seleccionado que tiene una cláusula LINAGE (ver File / Sort-Description ). Si hay varios archivos cuyas descripciones de archivos tienen cláusulas LINAGE , cualquier referencia explícita a este registro requerirá calificación (usando OF file-name . El valor de este registro será el número de línea lógica actual dentro del cuerpo de la página. El valor de este registro no se puede modificar.

trans-unit.source: BINARY-LONG SIGNED — This register contains the number of arguments passed to a subroutine — the same value that would be returned by theC$NARGbuilt-in system subroutine (see C$NARG). Its value will be zero when referenced in a main program. This register, when referenced from within a user-defined function, returns a value of one (1) if the function has any number of arguments and a zero if it has no arguments.
trans-unit.target: BINARY-LONG SIGNED: este registro contiene el número de argumentos pasados ​​a una subrutina, el mismo valor que devolvería la subrutina del sistema integrado C$NARG (consulte C $ NARG ). Su valor será cero cuando se haga referencia a él en un programa principal. Este registro, cuando se hace referencia a él desde una función definida por el usuario, devuelve un valor de uno (1) si la función tiene cualquier número de argumentos y un cero si no tiene argumentos.

trans-unit.source: BINARY-LONG SIGNED — This register is used to report the success/fail status of aRELEASE(see RELEASE) orRETURN(see RETURN) statement. A value of 0 is reported on success. A value of 16 denotes failure. AnAT END(see AT END + NOT AT END) condition on aRETURNis not considered a failure.
trans-unit.target: BINARY-LONG SIGNED: este registro se utiliza para informar el estado de éxito / fracaso de una declaración RELEASE (ver RELEASE ) o RETURN (ver RETURN ). Se informa un valor de 0 en caso de éxito. Un valor de 16 denota falla. Una condición AT END (ver AL FINAL + NO AL FINAL ) en un RETURN no se considera una falla.

trans-unit.source: BINARY-LONG SIGNED — This register provides a numeric data item into which a subroutine mayMOVE(see MOVE) a value (which will then be available to the calling program) prior to transferring control back to the program that called it, or into which a main program mayMOVEa value before returning control to the operating system. Many built-in subroutines will return a value using this register. These values are — by convention — used to signify success (usually with a value of 0) or failure (usually with a non-zero value) of the process the program was attempting to perform. This register may also be modified by a subprogram as a result of that subprogram’s use of theRETURNING(see PROCEDURE DIVISION RETURNING) clause.
trans-unit.target: BINARY-LONG SIGNED - Este registro proporciona un elemento de datos numéricos en el que una subrutina puede MOVE R (ver MOVER ) un valor (que luego estará disponible para el programa que llama) antes de transferir el control de nuevo al programa que lo llamó, o al que un programa principal puede MOVE R un valor antes de devolver el control al sistema operativo. Muchas subrutinas integradas devolverán un valor usando este registro. Estos valores se utilizan, por convención, para indicar el éxito (generalmente con un valor de 0) o el fracaso (generalmente con un valor distinto de cero) del proceso que el programa intentaba realizar. Este registro también puede ser modificado por un subprograma como resultado del uso de ese subprograma del RETURNING (ver PROCEDIMIENTO DIVISIÓN REGRESO) cláusula.

trans-unit.source: Because of its inherent readability, I would MUCH rather be handed an assignment to make significant changes to a COBOL program about which I know nothing than to be asked to do the same with a C, C++, C# or Java program.
trans-unit.target: Debido a su inherente legibilidad,preferiría que me asignaran la tarea de hacer cambios significativos en un programa COBOL del que no sé nada,a que me pidieran hacer lo mismo con un programa de C,C++,C#o Java.

trans-unit.source: Because of the catastrophic effect this statement has on program readability and therefore the programmer’s ability to debug problems with program logic, the use of ALTER in new programs is STRONGLY discouraged.

Because of the catastrophic effect this statement has on program readability and therefore the programmer’s ability to debug problems with program logic, the use ofALTERin new programs is STRONGLY discouraged.
trans-unit.target: Debido al efecto catastrófico que tiene esta declaración en la legibilidad del programa y, por lo tanto, en la capacidad del programador para depurar problemas con la lógica del programa, se desaconseja ENTRENAMENTE el uso de ALTER en programas nuevos .

trans-unit.source: Before continuing, it’s worth making the point that we’re

Before continuing, it’s worth making the point that we’re NOT talking about astronomical performance degradations here. Today’s computers are FAST, and a user sitting at the keyboard, running a GnuCOBOL program is unlikely to notice. BUT … if you have a GnuCOBOL program that has to process large amounts of data, performing some significant "number crunching" against that data as it goes, the impact of truncation could become noticeable.
trans-unit.target: Antes de continuar, vale la pena señalar que NO estamos hablando de degradaciones astronómicas del rendimiento aquí. Las computadoras de hoy son RÁPIDAS, y es poco probable que un usuario sentado al teclado, ejecutando un programa GnuCOBOL se dé cuenta. PERO ... si tiene un programa GnuCOBOL que tiene que procesar grandes cantidades de datos, realizando un "procesamiento numérico" significativo contra esos datos a medida que avanza, el impacto del truncamiento podría volverse notable.

trans-unit.source: Big-endian data allocation calls for the bytes that comprise a binary item to be allocated such that the least-significant byte is the right-most byte. For example, a four-byte binary item having a value of decimal 20 would be big-endian allocated as 00000014 (shown in hexadecimal notation).
trans-unit.target: La asignación de datos en grandes extensiones exige que los bytes que componen un elemento binario se asignen de manera que el byte menos significativo sea el byte de más a la derecha.Por ejemplo,un elemento binario de cuatro bytes que tenga un valor de 20 decimal sería un big-endian asignado como 00000014 (mostrado en notación hexadecimal).

trans-unit.source: Both of the above programs could have been written on a single line, if desired, and both languages allow a programmer to use (or not use) indentation as they see fit to improve program readability. Sounds like a tie so far.
trans-unit.target: Los dos programas anteriores podrían haberse escrito en una sola línea,si se desea,y ambos lenguajes permiten al programador utilizar (o no)la indentación como considere oportuno para mejorar la legibilidad del programa.Suena como un empate hasta ahora.

trans-unit.source: Both subroutines and user-defined functions may return a value. The value they return must be an integer in the range -2147483648 to +2147483647. This value will be available in the RETURN-CODE special register (see Special Registers) and also as the value of the data item specified on the RETURNING (see CALL) clause of a subroutine’s CALL.

Both subroutines and user-defined functions may return a value. The value they return must be an integer in the range -2147483648 to +2147483647. This value will be available in theRETURN-CODEspecial register (see Special Registers) and also as the value of the data item specified on theRETURNING(see CALL) clause of a subroutine’s CALL.
trans-unit.target: Tanto las subrutinas como las funciones definidas por el usuario pueden devolver un valor. El valor que devuelven debe ser un número entero en el rango de -2147483648 a +2147483647. Este valor estará disponible en el registro especial RETURN-CODE (ver Registros especiales ) y también como el valor del elemento de datos especificado en la RETURNING (ver CALL ) de la subrutina CALL.

trans-unit.source: By accepting from ARGUMENT-NUMBER, you will be asking the GnuCOBOL run-time system to parse the arguments from the command line and return the number of arguments found. Parsing will be conducted according to the following rules:

By accepting from ARGUMENT-VALUE, you will be asking the GnuCOBOL run-time system to parse the arguments from the command line and return the “current” argument. You specify which argument number is “current” via the ARGUMENT-NUMBER option on the DISPLAY statement (see DISPLAY UPON COMMAND-LINE). Parsing of arguments will be conducted according to the rules set forth above.

By accepting from ENVIRONMENT-VALUE, you will be asking the GnuCOBOL run-time system to retrieve the value of the environment variable whose name is currently in the ENVIRONMENT-NAME register. A value may be placed into the ENVIRONMENT-NAME register using the ENVIRONMENT-NAME option of the DISPLAY statement (see DISPLAY UPON ENVIRONMENT-NAME).

trans-unit.source: By convention throughout this document, COBOL reserved words will be shown entirely in UPPER-CASE while those words that were created by a programmer will be represented by tokens in mixed or lower case.

By convention throughout this document, COBOL reserved words will be shown entirely in UPPER-CASE while those words that were created by a programmer will be represented by tokens in mixed or lower case.
trans-unit.target: Por convención a lo largo de este documento,las palabras reservadas del COBOL se mostrarán enteramente en MAYÚSCULAS mientras que aquellas palabras que fueron creadas por un programador se representarán por fichas en mayúsculas o minúsculas.

trans-unit.source: By default, all arguments are assumed to be BY REFERENCE unless explicitly stated otherwise on the procedure division header.
By default, all arguments are assumed to beBY REFERENCEunless explicitly stated otherwise on the procedure division header.
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, se supone que todos los argumentos son BY REFERENCE menos que se indique explícitamente lo contrario en el encabezado de la división del procedimiento.

trans-unit.source: By default, procedure and procedure-and-statement tracing is off as programs begin execution. The READY TRACE statement (see READY TRACE) can be used to turn tracing on.
By default, procedure and procedure-and-statement tracing is off as programs begin execution. TheREADY TRACEstatement (see READY TRACE) can be used to turn tracing on.
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, el seguimiento de procedimientos y procedimientos y sentencias está desactivado cuando los programas comienzan a ejecutarse. La instrucción READY TRACE (consulte READY TRACE ) se puede utilizar para activar el seguimiento.

trans-unit.source: By default, the GnuCOBOL compiler will truncate binary data items to the precision indicated by their PICTURE (see PICTURE) clause, if they have one. This applies to COMP, BINARY and COMP-4 items Only. The fact is, however, that binary truncation has a significant effect on the performance of GnuCOBOL programs. When binary truncation is in effect, arithmetic operations performed against all types of numeric data items (even USAGE DISPLAY) are slowed down.

By default, the GnuCOBOL compiler will truncate binary data items to the precision indicated by theirPICTURE(see PICTURE) clause, if they have one. This applies to COMP, BINARY and COMP-4 items Only. The fact is, however, that binary truncation has a significant effect on the performance of GnuCOBOL programs. When binary truncation is in effect, arithmetic operations performed against all types of numeric data items (evenUSAGE DISPLAY are slowed down.
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, el compilador de GnuCOBOL truncará los elementos de datos binarios con la precisión indicada por su cláusula PICTURE (ver PICTURE ), si tienen una. Esto se aplica únicamente a los elementos COMP, BINARY y COMP-4. Sin embargo, el hecho es que el truncamiento binario tiene un efecto significativo en el rendimiento de los programas GnuCOBOL. Cuando el truncamiento binario está en vigor, las operaciones aritméticas realizadas contra todos los tipos de elementos de datos numéricos (incluso la USAGE DISPLAY se ralentizan.

trans-unit.source: By default, the program’s COLLATING SEQUENCE will, however, be based entirely on the bit-pattern values of the various characters.
By default, the program’sCOLLATING SEQUENCEwill, however, be based entirely on the bit-pattern values of the various characters.
trans-unit.target: Sin embargo, de forma predeterminada, la COLLATING SEQUENCE del programa se basará completamente en los valores del patrón de bits de los distintos caracteres.

trans-unit.source: By moving the user-interface onto the desktop; such efforts involve running modern-language front-end clients on user desktops (or laptops or smart phones, etc.) with COBOL programs providing server functionality on mainframe or midframe platforms, providing all the database and file "heavy lifting" on the back-end. Solutions like this provide users with the user-interfaces they want/need while still leveraging Cobol’s strengths on (possibly) downsized legacy mainframe or midframe systems.
trans-unit.target: Moviendo la interfaz de usuario al escritorio; Tales esfuerzos implican ejecutar clientes de interfaz de usuario de lenguaje moderno en computadoras de escritorio de usuario (o computadoras portátiles o teléfonos inteligentes, etc.) con programas COBOL que brindan funcionalidad de servidor en plataformas de mainframe o midframe, proporcionando toda la base de datos y el archivo "trabajo pesado" en la parte posterior. final. Soluciones como esta brindan a los usuarios las interfaces de usuario que desean / necesitan al mismo tiempo que aprovechan las fortalezas de Cobol en (posiblemente) sistemas heredados de mainframe o midframe de tamaño reducido.

trans-unit.source: By moving the user-interface onto the desktop; such efforts involve running modern-language front-end clients on user desktops (or laptops or smart phones, etc.) with COBOL programs providing server functionality on mainframe or midframe platforms, providing all the database and file “heavy lifting” on the back-end. Solutions like this provide users with the user-interfaces they want/need while still leveraging COBOL’s strengths on (possibly) downsized legacy mainframe or midframe systems.

trans-unit.target: Al ejecutarse en casi tantas plataformas informáticas diferentes como Java. No puede ejecutar programas COBOL en su teléfono inteligente, pero computadoras de escritorio, estaciones de trabajo, midframes / servidores, mainframes y supercomputadoras son un juego limpio.

trans-unit.source: By setting the specified condition-name-1(s) to a TRUE or FALSE value, you will actually be assigning a value to the parent data item(s) to which the condition name data item(s) is(are) subordinate to.

By specifying the EXTERNAL clause on either an FD or an SD, the file description is capable of being shared between all programs executed from the same execution thread, provided an EXTERNAL clause is coded with the file’s description in

By specifying the EXTERNAL clause on the description of a data item, the data item is capable of being shared between all programs executed from the same execution thread, provided the data item is coded (with an EXTERNAL clause) in each program requiring it.

By specifying the GLOBAL clause on the description of a data item, the data item is capable of being shared between a program and any nested subprograms within it, provided the data item is coded (with a GLOBAL clause) in each program requiring it.

By specifying the GLOBAL clause on the description of a file or a report, that description is capable of being shared between a program and any nested subprograms within it, provided the FD, SD or RD is coded (with a GLOBAL clause) in each nested subprogram requiring it. This sharing allows the file to be opened, read and/or written and closed or the report to be initiated or terminated in those programs. Separately compiled programs may not share a GLOBAL file description, but they may share an EXTERNAL (see EXTERNAL) file description. This sharing applies to the record descriptions subordinate to the file description and the report groups subordinate to the RD also.

By specifying theEXTERNALclause on either an FD or an SD, the file description is capable of being shared between all programs executed from the same execution thread, provided anEXTERNALclause is coded with the file’s description in
trans-unit.target: Al especificar la cláusula EXTERNAL en un FD o en una SD, la descripción del archivo puede compartirse entre todos los programas ejecutados desde el mismo hilo de ejecución, siempre que una cláusula EXTERNAL esté codificada con la descripción del archivo en

trans-unit.source: By specifying theEXTERNALclause on the description of a data item, the data item is capable of being shared between all programs executed from the same execution thread, provided the data item is coded (with anEXTERNALclause) in each program requiring it.
trans-unit.target: Al especificar la cláusula EXTERNAL en la descripción de un elemento de datos, el elemento de datos se puede compartir entre todos los programas ejecutados desde el mismo hilo de ejecución, siempre que el elemento de datos esté codificado (con una cláusula EXTERNAL ) en cada programa que lo requiera.

trans-unit.source: By specifying theGLOBALclause on the description of a data item, the data item is capable of being shared between a program and any nested subprograms within it, provided the data item is coded (with aGLOBALclause) in each program requiring it.
trans-unit.target: Al especificar la cláusula GLOBAL en la descripción de un elemento de datos, el elemento de datos se puede compartir entre un programa y cualquier subprograma anidado dentro de él, siempre que el elemento de datos esté codificado (con una cláusula GLOBAL ) en cada programa que lo requiera.

trans-unit.source: By specifying theGLOBALclause on the description of a file or a report, that description is capable of being shared between a program and any nested subprograms within it, provided theFDSDorRDis coded (with aGLOBALclause) in each nested subprogram requiring it. This sharing allows the file to be opened, read and/or written and closed or the report to be initiated or terminated in those programs. Separately compiled programs may not share aGLOBALfile description, but they may share anEXTERNAL(see EXTERNAL) file description. This sharing applies to the record descriptions subordinate to the file description and the report groups subordinate to theRDalso.
trans-unit.target: Al especificar la cláusula GLOBAL en la descripción de un archivo o informe, esa descripción puede compartirse entre un programa y cualquier subprograma anidado dentro de él, siempre que el FD SD o RD esté codificado (con una cláusula GLOBAL ) en cada subprograma anidado. requiriéndolo. Este intercambio permite que el archivo se abra, lea y / o escriba y cierre o que el informe se inicie o finalice en esos programas. Por otra parte los programas compilados pueden no compartir una GLOBAL descripción del archivo, pero pueden compartir una EXTERNAL (ver EXTERNO) Descripción del archivo. Este intercambio se aplica a las descripciones de registros subordinadas a la descripción de archivo y también a los grupos de informes subordinados al RD .

trans-unit.source: By undertaking so-called "modernization projects", where existing applications are either rewritten in "modern" languages or replaced outright with purchased packages. Most of these businesses are using such activities as an excuse to abandon "expensive" mainframes in favour of (presumably) less-expensive "open systems" (mid frame/server) solutions.
trans-unit.target: Realizando los llamados "proyectos de modernización",en los que las aplicaciones existentes se reescriben en idiomas "modernos" o se sustituyen directamente por paquetes comprados.La mayoría de esas empresas utilizan esas actividades como excusa para abandonar las "costosas" computadoras centrales en favor de soluciones (presumiblemente)menos costosas de "sistemas abiertos" (middle frame/server).

trans-unit.source: C actually has no “string” data type; it stores strings as an array of char data type items where each element of the array is a single character. Being an array, there is an upper limit to how many characters may be stored in a given “string”. For example:

C provides a robust set of string-manipulation functions to copy strings from one char array to another, search strings for certain characters, compare one char array to another, concatenate char arrays and so forth. To make these functions possible, it was necessary to be able to define the logical end of a string. C accomplishes this via the expectation that all strings (char arrays) will be terminated by a NULL character (x'00'). Of course, no one forces a programmer to do this, but if [s]he ever expects to use any of the C standard functions to manipulate that string they had

C provides a robust set of string-manipulation functions to copy strings from one char array to another, search strings for certain characters, compare one char array to another, concatenate char arrays and so forth. To make these functions possible, it was necessary to be able to define the logical end of a string. C accomplishes this via the expectation that all strings (char arrays) will be terminated by a NULL character (x’00’). Of course, no one forces a programmer to do this, but if [s]he ever expects to use any of the C standard functions to manipulate that string they had
trans-unit.target: C proporciona un conjunto robusto de funciones de manipulación de cadenas para copiar cadenas de una matriz de caracteres a otra, buscar cadenas de ciertos caracteres, comparar una matriz de caracteres con otra, concatenar matrices de caracteres, etc. Para hacer posibles estas funciones, era necesario poder definir el final lógico de una cadena. C logra esto a través de la expectativa de que todas las cadenas (matrices de caracteres) terminarán con un carácter NULL (x'00 '). Por supuesto, nadie obliga a un programador a hacer esto, pero si alguna vez espera usar alguna de las funciones estándar de C para manipular esa cadena,

trans-unit.source: COBOL (GnuCOBOL included) still requires that each procedure division paragraph contain at least one sentence if there is any executable code in that paragraph, but a popular coding style is now to simply code a single period right before the end of each paragraph.
trans-unit.target: COBOL (GnuCOBOL incluido)todavía requiere que cada párrafo de división de procedimientos contenga al menos una frase si hay algún código ejecutable en ese párrafo,pero un estilo de codificación popular es ahora simplemente codificar un único punto justo antes del final de cada párrafo.

trans-unit.source: COBOL (the default) the program name is treated as a COBOL word that maps to the externalised name program to be called, cancelled or referenced in the program-address-identifier, applying the same mapping rules as for a program name for which no AS phrase is specified.
trans-unit.target: COBOL (el predeterminado)el nombre del programa se trata como una palabra COBOL que se mapea al programa de nombre externalizado para ser llamado,cancelado o referenciado en el identificador de dirección del programa,aplicando las mismas reglas de mapeo que para un nombre de programa para el que no se especifica ninguna frase AS.

trans-unit.source: COBOL allows data names to be duplicated within a program, provided references to those data names may be made in such a manner as to make those references unique through a process known as qualification.

COBOL introduced the concept of structured data. The principle of structured data in COBOL is based on the idea of being able to group related and contiguously-allocated data items together into a single aggregate data item, called a Group Item. For example, a 35-character ’Employee-Name’ group item might consist of a 20-character ’Last-Name’ followed by a 14-character ’First-Name’ and a 1-character ’Middle-Initial’.

COBOL introduced the concept of structured data. The principle of structured data in COBOL is based on the idea of being able to group related and contiguously-allocated data items together into a single aggregate data item, called a ’

trans-unit.source: COBOL uses parenthesis to specify the subscripts used to reference table entries (tables in COBOL are what other programming languages refer to as arrays).
COBOL uses the concept of a

COBOL uses the concept of a "level number" to indicate the level at which a data item occurs in a data structure such as the example shown above. When these data items are defined, they are all defined together with a number in the range 1-49 specified in front of their names. Over the years, a convention has come to exist among COBOL programmers that level numbers are always coded as two-digit numbers — they don’t
trans-unit.target: COBOL utiliza el concepto de "número de nivel" para indicar el nivel en el que se produce un elemento de datos en una estructura de datos como el ejemplo que se muestra arriba. Cuando se definen estos elementos de datos, todos se definen junto con un número en el rango de 1-49 especificado delante de sus nombres. A lo largo de los años, ha surgido una convención entre los programadores COBOL de que los números de nivel siempre se codifican como números de dos dígitos, no es así.

trans-unit.source: COBOL, first introduced to the programming public in 1959, was the very first programming language to become standardized (in 1960). This meant that a standard-compliant COBOL program written on computer "A" made by company "B" would be able to be compiled and executed on computer "X" made by company "Y" with very few, if any, changes. This may not seem like such a big deal today, but it was a radical departure from all programming languages that came before it and even many that came after it.
trans-unit.target: El COBOL,introducido por primera vez al público de la programación en 1959,fue el primer lenguaje de programación que se estandarizó (en 1960).Esto significó que un programa COBOL que cumpliera con los estándares,escrito en la computadora "A" hecha por la compañía "B",podría ser compilado y ejecutado en la computadora "X" hecha por la compañía "Y" con muy pocos,si es que alguno,cambios.Esto puede no parecer tan importante hoy en día,pero fue un cambio radical de todos los lenguajes de programación que vinieron antes e incluso muchos que vinieron después.

trans-unit.source: COBOL, first introduced to the programming public in 1959, was the very first programming language to become standardized (in 1960). This meant that a standard-compliant COBOL program written on computer “A” made by company “B” would be able to be compiled and executed on computer “X” made by company “Y” with very few, if any, changes. This may not seem like such a big deal today, but it was a radical departure from all programming languages that came before it and even many that came after it.

trans-unit.source: Call Folding

Call also supports using an entry point stored in a PROGRAM-POINTER, avoiding the dynamic runtime lookup. GnuCOBOL keeps a cache of lookups during a program run. Repeated use of a named function does not suffer much penalty, but PROGRAM-POINTER will be just that little bit faster. To set a PROGRAM-POINTER use SET program-reference TO ENTRY "name" (or get the address from an API, and take part in callback programming).

Care must be taken that programs reading such a file describe records whose length is exactly the same as that used by the program that created the file. For example, the following shows the contents of aSEQUENTIALfile created by a program that wrote five 6-character records to it. The "A", "B", … values reflect the records that were written to the file:
trans-unit.target: Se debe tener cuidado de que los programas que leen un archivo de este tipo describan registros cuya longitud sea exactamente la misma que la utilizada por el programa que creó el archivo. Por ejemplo, a continuación se muestra el contenido de un archivo SEQUENTIAL creado por un programa que escribió cinco registros de 6 caracteres en él. Los valores "A", "B", ... reflejan los registros que se escribieron en el archivo:

trans-unit.source: Care must be taken that programs reading such a file describe records whose length is exactly the same as that used by the programs that created the file. It won’t end well if the GnuCOBOL runtime library interprets a four-byte ASCII character string as a record length when it transfers data from the file into the program!
trans-unit.target: Se debe tener cuidado de que los programas que leen un archivo de este tipo describan registros cuya longitud sea exactamente la misma que la utilizada por los programas que crearon el archivo. ¡No terminará bien si la biblioteca en tiempo de ejecución de GnuCOBOL interpreta una cadena de caracteres ASCII de cuatro bytes como una longitud de registro cuando transfiere datos desde el archivo al programa!

trans-unit.source: Critics of COBOL frequently focus on the wordiness of the language, often citing the case of a so-called “Hello World” program as the “proof” that COBOL is so much more tedious to program in than more “modern” languages. Data item descriptions describing the report lines and fields that make up the substance of a report group immediately follow the definition of that group.

Data items declared with BASED are allocated no storage at compilation time. At run-time, the ALLOCATE (see ALLOCATE) or SET ADDRESS (see SET ADDRESS) statements are used to allocate space for and (optionally) initialize such items.

Data items declared with the ANY LENGTH attribute have no fixed compile-time length. Such items may only be defined in the linkage section of a subprogram as they may only serve as subroutine argument descriptions. These items must have a PICTURE (see PICTURE) clause that specifies exactly one A, X or 9 symbol.

Data items declared with theANY LENGTHattribute have no fixed compile-time length. Such items may only be defined in the linkage section of a subprogram as they may only serve as subroutine argument descriptions. These items must have aPICTURE(see PICTURE) clause that specifies exactly one A, X or 9 symbol.
trans-unit.target: Los elementos de datos declarados con el atributo ANY LENGTH no tienen una duración de tiempo de compilación fija. Dichos elementos solo pueden definirse en la sección de vínculos de un subprograma, ya que solo pueden servir como descripciones de argumentos de subrutina. Estos elementos deben tener una cláusula PICTURE (ver PICTURE ) que especifique exactamente un símbolo A, X o 9.

trans-unit.source: Data items declared withBASEDare allocated no storage at compilation time. At run-time, theALLOCATE(see ALLOCATE) orSET ADDRESS(see SET ADDRESS) statements are used to allocate space for and (optionally) initialize such items.
trans-unit.target: Los elementos de datos declarados con BASED no se almacenan en el momento de la compilación. En tiempo de ejecución, las ALLOCATE (consulte ALLOCATE ) o SET ADDRESS (consulte SET ADDRESS ) se utilizan para asignar espacio y (opcionalmente) inicializar dichos elementos.

trans-unit.source: Data items defined in a calling program may be passed to either type of called program (subroutine or user-defined function) as arguments.
trans-unit.target: Los elementos de datos definidos en un programa de llamada pueden ser pasados a cualquier tipo de programa de llamada (subrutina o función definida por el usuario)como argumentos.

trans-unit.source: Data items defined in the screen section describe input, output or combination screen layouts to be used with ACCEPT screen-data-item statement (see ACCEPT screen-data-item) or DISPLAY screen-data-item statement (see DISPLAY screen-data-item) statements. These screen layouts may define the entire available screen area or any subset of it.

Data items defined in the screen section describe input, output or combination screen layouts to be used withACCEPT screen-data-itemstatement (see ACCEPT screen-data-item) orDISPLAY screen-data-itemstatement (see DISPLAY screen-data-item) statements. These screen layouts may define the entire available screen area or any subset of it.
trans-unit.target: Los elementos de datos definidos en la sección de pantalla describen los diseños de pantalla de entrada, salida o combinación que se utilizarán con la declaración ACCEPT screen-data-item (ver ACCEPT screen-data-item ) o la declaración DISPLAY screen-data-item (vea DISPLAY screen- data -item- artículo ) declaraciones. Estos diseños de pantalla pueden definir toda el área de pantalla disponible o cualquier subconjunto de ella.

trans-unit.source: Data items defined within the working-storage section are automatically initialized once — as the program in which the data is defined is loaded into memory. Subprograms may be loaded into memory more than once (see the CANCEL statement (see CANCEL)), in which case initialization will happen each time they are loaded. See Data Initialization, for a discussion of the initialization rules.

Data items defined within the working-storage section are automatically initialized once — as the program in which the data is defined is loaded into memory. Subprograms may be loaded into memory more than once (see theCANCELstatement (see CANCEL)), in which case initialization will happen each time they are loaded. See Data Initialization, for a discussion of the initialization rules.
trans-unit.target: Los elementos de datos definidos dentro de la sección de almacenamiento de trabajo se inicializan automáticamente una vez, ya que el programa en el que se definen los datos se carga en la memoria. Los subprogramas se pueden cargar en la memoria más de una vez (ver la instrucción CANCEL (ver CANCEL )), en cuyo caso la inicialización ocurrirá cada vez que se carguen. Consulte Inicialización de datos , para obtener más información sobre las reglas de inicialización.

trans-unit.source: Despite statements from industry “insiders”, the COBOL programming language is not dead, even though newer and so-called “modern” languages like Java, C#, .NET, Ruby on Rails and so on appear to have become the languages of choice in the Information Technology world. These languages have become popular because they address the following desired requirements for “modern” programming:

Piense en ello como una secuencia de dos pasos, primero copiando el <

trans-unit.source: Despite what the name of this routine might make you believe, this routine is more than just a simple “rename” — it will actually move the file supplied as the 1<sup>st</sup> argument to the file specified as the 2nd argument. Think of it as a two-step sequence, first copying the <var>old-file-path</var> file to the <var>new-file-path</var> file and then a second step where the <var>old-file-path</var> is deleted.

Despite what you’ve seen here, the more complex the programming logic being implemented, the more concise the Java code will appear to be, even compared to 2002-standard COBOL. That conciseness comes with a price though — program code readability. Java (or C or C++ or C#) programs are generally intelligible only to trained programmers. COBOL programs can, however, be quite understandable by non-programmers. This is actually a side-effect of the "wordiness" of the language, where COBOL statements use natural English words to describe their actions. This inherent readability has come in handy many times throughout my career when I’ve had to learn obscure business (or legal) processes by reading the COBOL program code that supports them.
trans-unit.target: A pesar de lo que ha visto aquí, cuanto más compleja sea la lógica de programación que se está implementando, más conciso parecerá el código Java, incluso en comparación con el estándar COBOL de 2002. Sin embargo, esa concisión tiene un precio: la legibilidad del código del programa. Los programas Java (o C o C ++ o C #) son generalmente inteligibles solo para programadores capacitados. Sin embargo, los programas COBOL pueden ser bastante comprensibles para quienes no son programadores. En realidad, esto es un efecto secundario de la "palabrería" del idioma, donde las declaraciones COBOL usan palabras naturales en inglés para describir sus acciones. Esta legibilidad inherente ha sido útil muchas veces a lo largo de mi carrera cuando tuve que aprender procesos comerciales (o legales) oscuros leyendo el código del programa COBOL que los respalda.

trans-unit.source: Despite what you’ve seen here, the more complex the programming logic being implemented, the more concise the Java code will appear to be, even compared to 2002-standard COBOL. That conciseness comes with a price though — program code readability. Java (or C or C++ or C#) programs are generally intelligible only to trained programmers. COBOL programs can, however, be quite understandable by non-programmers. This is actually a side-effect of the “wordiness” of the language, where COBOL statements use natural English words to describe their actions. This inherent readability has come in handy many times throughout my career when I’ve had to learn obscure business (or legal) processes by reading the COBOL program code that supports them.

trans-unit.source: Did you notice that there are two each of Year, Month and Day data names defined? That’s perfectly legal, provided that each can be uniquely qualified so as to be distinct from the other. Take for example the Year items. One is defined as part of the From-Date data item while the other is defined as part of the To-Date data item. In COBOL, we would actually code references to these two data items as either Year OF From-Date and Year OF To-Date or Year IN From-Date and Year IN To-Date (COBOL allows either IN or OF to be used). Since these references would clarify any confusion to us as to which Year might be referenced, the GnuCOBOL compiler won’t be confused either.

Did you notice that there are two each ofYearMonthandDaydata names defined? That’s perfectly legal, provided that each can be uniquelyqualifiedso as to be distinct from the other. Take for example theYearitems. One is defined as part of theFrom-Datedata item while the other is defined as part of the "To-Date" data item. In COBOL, we would actually code references to these two data items as eitherYear OF From-DateandYear OF To-DateorYear IN From-DateandYear IN To-Date(COBOL allows eitherINorOFto be used). Since these references would clarify any confusion to us as to whichYearmight be referenced, the GnuCOBOL compiler won’t be confused either.
trans-unit.target: ¿Notó que hay dos nombres de datos de Year Month y Day definidos? Eso es perfectamente legal, siempre que cada uno pueda ser qualified manera única para ser distinto del otro. Tomemos, por ejemplo, los elementos del Year . Uno se define como parte del elemento de datos From-Date , mientras que el otro se define como parte del elemento de datos "Hasta la fecha". En COBOL, codificaríamos las referencias a estos dos elementos de datos como Year OF From-Date y Year OF To-Date o Year IN From-Date y Year IN To-Date (COBOL permite IN o OF para ser utilizado). Dado que estas referencias nos aclararían cualquier confusión en cuanto a qué Year podría hacer referencia, el compilador de GnuCOBOL tampoco se confundirá.

trans-unit.source: Dynamically-loadable modules will be named

Dynamically-loadable modules will be named "xxxxxxxx.dll" on a Windows system, "xxxxxxxx.so" on a Unix system or "xxxxxxxx.dylib" on an OSX system, where "xxxxxxxx" exactly matches, including the usage of upper- and lower-case letters, the primary entry-point name PROGRAM-IDorFUNCTION-ID or an alternate entry point name defined via theENTRYstatement (see ENTRY) of any one of the GnuCOBOL programs included in that module.
trans-unit.target: Los módulos cargables dinámicamente se denominarán "xxxxxxxx.dll" en un sistema Windows, "xxxxxxxx.so" en un sistema Unix o "xxxxxxxx.dylib" en un sistema OSX, donde "xxxxxxxx" coincide exactamente, incluido el uso de y letras minúsculas, el nombre del punto de entrada principal PROGRAM-ID o FUNCTION-ID o un nombre de punto de entrada alternativo definido mediante la declaración ENTRY (ver ENTRY ) de cualquiera de los programas GnuCOBOL incluidos en ese módulo.

trans-unit.source: Dynamically-loaded subprograms are executed (from a COBOL syntax point of view) just like any other subprograms. What makes them unique, however, is that they are loaded into memory only when they are actually used the first time during the execution of a program.
trans-unit.target: Los subprogramas cargados dinámicamente se ejecutan (desde el punto de vista de la sintaxis COBOL)como cualquier otro subprograma.Lo que los hace únicos,sin embargo,es que se cargan en la memoria sólo cuando se utilizan realmente la primera vez durante la ejecución de un programa.

trans-unit.source: Each >>IF directive must be terminated by an >>END-IF directive.
Each RD will have the following allocated for it:
Each WHEN clause (other than the WHEN OTHER clause, if any) must have the same number of Selection-Object clauses as there are Selection-Subject clauses.

Each CDF-Conditional-Expression-n will be evaluated, in turn, in the sequence in which they are coded in the >>IF statement and any >>ELIF clauses that may be present until one evaluates to TRUE. Once one of them evaluates to TRUE, the Program-Source-Lines-n block of code that corresponds to the TRUECDF-Conditional-Expression-n will be one that is processed. All others within the >>IF->>END-IF scope will be ignored.
Each ENTRY-Argument specified on the ENTRY statement must be defined in the linkage section of the subroutine in which the ENTRY statement exists.
Each conditional-expression-n will be evaluated, in turn, until either one evaluates to a value of TRUE or all have evaluated to FALSE.

Each file-name-1, file-name-2 and file-name-3 (if specified) must reference ORGANIZATION LINE SEQUENTIAL (see ORGANIZATION LINE SEQUENTIAL) or ORGANIZATION SEQUENTIAL (see ORGANIZATION SEQUENTIAL) files. These files must be defined using a file description (FD (see File/Sort-Description)).

Each report-name-1 must be the name of a report having an RD (see REPORT SECTION) defined for it.

trans-unit.source: Early versions of Micro Focus COBOL allowed programmers to access various runtime library routines by using a single two-digit hexadecimal number as the entry-point name. These were known as call-by-number routines. Over time, Micro Focus COBOL evolved, replacing most of the call-by-number routines with ones accessible using a more conventional call-by-name technique.
trans-unit.target: Las primeras versiones de Micro Focus COBOL permitían a los programadores acceder a varias rutinas de librerías de tiempo de ejecución utilizando un único número hexadecimal de dos dígitos como nombre del punto de entrada.Estas eran conocidas como rutinas de llamada por número.Con el tiempo,Micro Focus COBOL evolucionó,reemplazando la mayoría de las rutinas de llamada por número con otras accesibles usando una técnica más convencional de llamada por nombre.

trans-unit.source: Effortlessly providing arithmetic accuracy to 31 digits, with performance approaching that of well-written assembly-language programs. Don’t think this isn’t critically important to banks, investment houses and any business interested in tracking revenues, expenses and profits (duh - like ALL of them).
trans-unit.target: Proporciona sin esfuerzo una precisión aritmética de 31 dígitos, con un rendimiento que se acerca al de los programas en lenguaje ensamblador bien escritos. No crea que esto no es de importancia crítica para los bancos, las casas de inversión y cualquier negocio interesado en rastrear ingresos, gastos y ganancias (obvio, como TODOS).

trans-unit.source: Eight (8) different colors may be specified for both the background (screen) and foreground (text) color of any row/column position on the screen. Colors are specified by number, although a copybook supplied with all GnuCOBOL distributions (

Eight (8) different colors may be specified for both the background (screen) and foreground (text) color of any row/column position on the screen. Colors are specified by number, although a copybook supplied with all GnuCOBOL distributions ("screenio.cpy") defines COB-COLOR-xxxxxx names for the various colors so they may be specified as a more meaningful name rather than a number. The eight colors, by number, with the constant names defined in screenio.cpy, are as follows:

Either a statement that begins with a non decision-making verb and specifies an unconditional action to be taken or a conditional verb such as IF or EVALUATE, delimited by its explicit scope terminator (such as END-IF or END-EVALUATE). An imperative statement can consist of a sequence of imperative statements.

Either a statement that begins with a non decision-making verb and specifies an unconditional action to be taken or a conditional verb such asIForEVALUATE delimited by its explicit scope terminator (such asEND-IForEND-EVALUATE. An imperative statement can consist of a sequence of imperative statements.

Una declaración imperativa puede Consisten en una secuencia de declaraciones imperativas.

trans-unit.source: Either or both of the 1<sup>st</sup> two arguments may be an alphanumeric literal, a group item or an elementary item appropriate to storing alphabetic or alphanumeric data. If the lengths of the two arguments are unequal, the shorter will be assumed to be padded to the right with spaces.

Either or both of the 1st two arguments may be an alphanumeric literal, a group item or an elementary item appropriate to storing alphabetic or alphanumeric data. If the lengths of the two arguments are unequal, the shorter will be assumed to be padded to the right with spaces.
trans-unit.target: Uno o ambos de los dos primeros argumentos pueden ser un literal alfanumérico,un elemento de grupo o un elemento elemental apropiado para almacenar datos alfabéticos o alfanuméricos.Si las longitudes de los dos argumentos son desiguales,se supondrá que el más corto está rellenado a la derecha con espacios.

trans-unit.source: Either the USAGE (see USAGE) of index-name-1 should be INDEX, or index-name-1 must be identified in a table INDEXED BY clause.

Either the name of an identifier or a procedure in the program. GnuCOBOL limits user-defined names to a maximum of 31 characters taken from the set of numeric digits, upper- and lower-case letters, hyphens and underscores. A user-defined name may neither begin nor end with a hyphen or underscore. User-defined names used as file names may additionally not begin with a digit although - unlike many other programming languages - user-defined names used as identifiers or procedure names may.
trans-unit.target: El nombre de un identificador o un procedimiento en el programa.GnuCOBOL limita los nombres definidos por el usuario a un máximo de 31 caracteres tomados del conjunto de dígitos numéricos,letras mayúsculas y minúsculas,guiones y guiones bajos.Un nombre definido por el usuario no puede comenzar ni terminar con un guión o un guión bajo.Los nombres definidos por el usuario que se utilicen como nombres de fichero tampoco pueden comenzar con un dígito,aunque,a diferencia de muchos otros lenguajes de programación,los nombres definidos por el usuario que se utilicen como identificadores o nombres de procedimiento sí pueden hacerlo.

trans-unit.source: Every entry-point has a name. That name must be unique for all programs that comprise an executable program. Entry-point names are defined using a subroutine’s PROGRAM-ID paragraph, a user-defined function’s FUNCTION-ID paragraph or via ENTRY (see ENTRY) statements coded in a subprogram’s procedure division.

Every entry-point has a name. That name must be unique for all programs that comprise an executable program. Entry-point names are defined using a subroutine’sPROGRAM-IDparagraph, a user-defined function’sFUNCTION-IDparagraph or viaENTRY(see ENTRY) statements coded in a subprogram’s procedure division.
trans-unit.target: Cada punto de entrada tiene un nombre. Ese nombre debe ser único para todos los programas que componen un programa ejecutable. Nombres de punto de entrada se definen utilizando de una subrutina PROGRAM-ID párrafo, de una función definida por el usuario FUNCTION-ID párrafo o a través de ENTRY (ver ENTRADA ) estados codificados en la división procedimiento de un subprograma.

trans-unit.source: Every file that has been referenced by a SELECT statement (see SELECT) must also be described in the file section of the data division.
Every new level uses a level number that is strictly greater than the one used in the parent (next higher) level.
trans-unit.target: Cada nuevo nivel utiliza un número de nivel que es estrictamente mayor que el utilizado en el nivel padre (el siguiente más alto).

trans-unit.target: Cada programa tiene al menos un punto de entrada, conocido como el punto de entrada principal, que corresponde a la primera declaración ejecutable en la división de procedimiento que sigue al área de declarativos, si corresponde.

trans-unit.source: Every report has the same basic structure, as shown here, even though not all reports will have all of the groups shown. In fact, it is a very unusual report indeed that actually has every one of these groups:

trans-unit.source: Every report that employs control breaks has a natural hierarchy of those control breaks based upon the manner in which the data the report is being generated from is sorted. This concept is best understood using an example which assumes a COBOL program to process sales data collected from every computerized cash register across a chain of stores having multiple departments is being developed.
trans-unit.target: Todo informe que emplea interrupciones de control tiene una jerarquía natural de esas interrupciones de control basada en la manera en que se clasifican los datos a partir de los cuales se genera el informe.Este concepto se entiende mejor usando un ejemplo que supone que se está desarrollando un programa COBOL para procesar los datos de ventas recogidos de cada caja registradora computarizada a través de una cadena de tiendas con múltiples departamentos.

trans-unit.source: Every sort file description (SD or FD) must be followed by at least one 01-level data item, except for file descriptions containing the REPORT IS clause. These 01-level data items, in turn, may be broken down into subordinate group and elementary items. An 01-level data item defined here in the file section is also known as a Record, even if it is an elementary item, provided that elementary item lacks the CONSTANT attribute.

trans-unit.source: Executing a DISPLAY UPON COMMAND-LINE will influence subsequent ACCEPT FROM COMMAND-LINE statements (which will then return the value you displayed), but will not influence subsequent ACCEPT FROM ARGUMENT-VALUE statements — these will continue to return the original program execution parameters.

Executing aDISPLAY UPON COMMAND-LINEwill influence subsequentACCEPT FROM COMMAND-LINEstatements (which will then return the value you displayed), but will not influence subsequentACCEPT FROM ARGUMENT-VALUEstatements — these will continue to return the original program execution parameters.

trans-unit.source: Executing the statement SET condition-name-1 TO FALSE will cause condition-name-1’s parent data item to take on the value specified on condition-name-1’s FALSE clause. If condition-name-1 does not have a FALSE clause, the SET (see SET) statement will generate an error message at compilation time.
Executing the statement SET condition-name-1 TO TRUE will cause condition-name-1’s parent data item to take on the first value specified on condition-name-1’s VALUE clause.

trans-unit.source: Execution of the calling program is suspended and control will transfer to the called program, as follows:
trans-unit.target: La ejecución del programa de llamada se suspende y el control se transferirá al programa de llamada,de la siguiente manera:

trans-unit.source: Execution will begin at the first executable statement following the subprograms entry-point. The entry point will be either the first executable statement following any DECLARATIVES (see DECLARATIVES) that might be present (if the subprogram was invoked using its primary entry-point name) or the first executable statement following the ENTRY statement (see ENTRY) naming the entry-point specified on the CALL if the subprogram was invoked using an alternate entry point.

Execution will begin at the first executable statement following the subprograms entry-point. The entry point will be either the first executable statement following anyDECLARATIVES(see DECLARATIVES) that might be present (if the subprogram was invoked using its primary entry-point name) or the first executable statement following theENTRYstatement (see ENTRY) naming the entry-point specified on theCALLif the subprogram was invoked using an alternate entry point.
trans-unit.target: La ejecución comenzará en la primera instrucción ejecutable que sigue al punto de entrada de los subprogramas. El punto de entrada será la primera instrucción ejecutable después de cualquier DECLARATIVES (ver DECLARATIVES ) que pueda estar presente (si el subprograma fue invocado usando su nombre de punto de entrada principal) o la primera instrucción ejecutable después de la instrucción ENTRY (ver ENTRY ) nombrando el punto de entrada especificado en la CALL si el subprograma se invocó utilizando un punto de entrada alternativo.

trans-unit.source: Execution will begin with the first executable statement in the procedure division following any DECLARATIVES (see DECLARATIVES) that might be present.
Execution will begin with the first executable statement in the procedure division following anyDECLARATIVES(see DECLARATIVES) that might be present.
trans-unit.target: La ejecución comenzará con la primera instrucción ejecutable en la división del procedimiento después de cualquier DECLARATIVES (ver DECLARATIVES ) que pueda estar presente.

trans-unit.source: Execution will resume back in the calling program at the point where the returned value of the function is needed. At that point, the value in the RETURN-CODE special register will be used for the function’s value.

Execution will resume back in the calling program at the point where the returned value of the function is needed. At that point, the value in theRETURN-CODEspecial register will be used for the function’s value.
trans-unit.target: La ejecución se reanudará en el programa de llamada en el punto donde se necesita el valor devuelto de la función. En ese momento, el valor en el registro especial RETURN-CODE se usará para el valor de la función.

trans-unit.source: Execution will resume back in the calling program with the first executable statement following the CALL that invoked the subprogram.
Execution will resume back in the calling program with the first executable statement following theCALLthat invoked the subprogram.
trans-unit.target: La ejecución se reanudará en el programa de llamada con la primera instrucción ejecutable después de la CALL que invocó el subprograma.
